title: Cosmic Reaver Kassadin
body:
Hate to bring this up again, but did anyone else notice how we weren't told what funds were actually earned for the "charity event" and what charity they actually went to.

This is being brought up because someone mentioned CR Kassadin to me and i realized that i don't recall ever being told, and i couldn't find it via searching.

replies.body:
Hey Jason! 

We're still working on identifying what specific organisation we're going to be working with. It's a bit of an involved process as I want to make sure we pick a reputable organisation, the right cause and making sure that we know what the donation is going to impact. 

Since we haven't done this in Oceania before, we're spending a lot of time researching to make sure we pick the right place. We're working with some experts from our NA office to help guide us on this. We should have a much better update in the near future. 

This is absolutely something that we're following up on and want to make sure it's done as quickly as possible, but also thoroughly.

So this is the naut reef all over again, not to mention you were willing to just leave us in the dark on this instead of inform us after you straight out screwed over the OCE player base with your actions regarding CR Kassadin.

Like it's all good your donating to charity, but this is probably the most disgusting way to do it.

EDIT: Just so we are clear, this doesn't need a Riot response, this just needs to be a reality check for Riot OCE.

"Just so we are clear, this doesn't need a Riot response, this just needs to be a reality check for Riot OCE."

TLDR:
"Don't reply with an answer that shows how wrong i am and make me look stupid, just do what i want!"

No it's don't bother wasting your time with a reply, because i really give no fucks, as this is just another showing of uselessness from Rito OCE.

Honestly i've boycotted even buying RP because Riot OCE has shown what they think about us in general, you know, to the point we aren't even worth proper updates (anyone seen the list for the naut statue names? they said they would release that shortly when it was just after ocean week.)

> Riot OCE has shown what they think about us in general

That they care about their community? That they are players too and understand our frustrations? That they generally have insight we cannot understand and that they sometimes cannot share? That they do their best for us and what they get in return is "You're all idiots, we hate you, you do nothing for us" when that is about as far from the truth as it can get? That business decision aren't one man decisions and thus take time and resources to reach?

You can't just dump something in the ocean, you'll get sued with good reason, especially in ecosystems as complex and fragile as the GBR. As for the list of names, I recall reading something about it not just being points, but also not being banned within a certain span of time, so it is entirely possible they are still working through the data to work out exactly who is on the list because the punishment data comes from elsewhere. 

You're complaining about something that has absolutely no effect on you. If you don't want the skin don't buy it. Or do you own every single skin in the game?

The single most amazing thing about Riot as a company is that they demonstrate to their community that they too are PEOPLE. It's not just one big machine like most other companies that only care about profits and churning out new games. Riot as a company, League as a game is so different because there is passion behind the work. These are people that genuinely care about the product they are responsible for. Blizzard is for the most part another notable example of what maintaining that passion and humanity can accomplish. 

And yet here you are, tearing down real people like the ass you are just because...what? A few pixels was gonna cost you some money? Money that is going to charity no less. In the scope of a game of this quality that you can play entirely for free if you want...sorry but that's utter horsecrap. Complete bullshit. Sheer donkey balls. Get the stick out of your ass and get over yourself. I'd like to see you do better than the frankly lovely HUMAN BEINGS we have working FOR US here at Riot OCE.



**And to the Riot employees that may or may not read this. **Know that I may not always agree with you, but I'll always have your back, because I'm not stupid enough to believe your job is easy, or that you can just magic things right for us. Negativity stands out as you well know, but there are those of us here that will always have faith in you guys, so whenever any of you are having a bad day, just remember that there are and always will be those of us here who have your back.

>You can't just dump something in the ocean

I stopped reading here, if you don't want to read, i'm not going to.

EDIT: Actually on second gloss

>A few pixels was gonna cost you some money? Money that is going to charity no less.

Learn to read and not just abuse people, i actually thought you were one that was all for reading rather then unwarranted shit talking over nothing.

Forgive me if I'm mistaken but it largely seems as if you are complaining that it cost money in the first place (not in the original post, in the ensuing discussion). That is what I have a problem with here, hence the quote.

The first quote was to illustrate a point.

Well 1. i really don't mind how they have handled the Naut statue in general (the update amount is slightly low, but red tape can be expected, the main qualm i have with the Naut statue at this point is the lack of a name list)

2. It's not just that it cost money, honestly it's a mix of the following 3 things.
a) That it's our server skin, and it's relation to us is about as blatant as it's relation to everywhere else in the world (Minus putting the southern cross on it)
b) That it's our server skin, and we aren't getting it for free (note i would be fine with this if it was the only one of these 3 present.)
c) That riot is trying to cover the fact that they aren't giving us the skin for free, to do a half assed charity giveaway (Which lets be honest, this is what it is, or else why isn't the charity getting the funds from All sales (not just OCE), and why hasn't the funds been recieved by said charity.)

Yes this may seem like it's all about the money, but it really isn't, this is just the general "We are going to screw you guys over, but in a way that makes us look good" as they have been for a long while, and honestly i'm just sick of it to the point where i'm honestly not putting another cent into this game until they damn well show that they are worth it.

EDIT: Gotta love the boards code, RIP Forums, we still miss you.

I will agree to disagree, but I will say I hardly believe they were trying to screw us over, it'd be a pretty poor business decision wouldn't it? Even if you were to assume it WAS all about money. 

I believe it was more along the lines of a roadblock they encountered at which point they had two options. Deny us a skin entirely, or give us one with certain compromises, and thus the charity bit was done as damage control on a situation they knew would not go as favourably as they might hope.

As for you not liking the skin, that's personal opinion, I honestly love the skin, the concept very much appeals to me, and what I deem worthwhile art. Not all their skins do, I very much dislike Zombie Nunu for example, I'm sure plenty of people would disagree. And as far as my childhood was concerned, the Southern Cross WAS important. Maybe it is important to other parts of the world too, but so are toilets, but we can still appreciate them.

>Deny us a skin entirely, or give us one with certain compromises, and thus the charity bit was done as damage control on a situation they knew would not go as favourably as they might hope.

And this comes down to basically what happened with Duke Nukem Forever, first game was great, but honestly the sequel should have never came out because it was always going to be worse then expectations, same with this region's skin, either do it right or not at all, the backlash was never going to be worth it.

>As for you not liking the skin, that's personal opinion, I honestly love the skin, the concept very much appeals to me, and what I deem worthwhile art. Not all their skins do, I very much dislike Zombie Nunu for example, I'm sure plenty of people would disagree. And as far as my childhood was concerned, the Southern Cross WAS important. Maybe it is important to other parts of the world too, but so are toilets, but we can still appreciate them.

Design wise it's alright i guess, this isn't really the problem, nor is the fact that it's the Southern Cross, it's the fact that if the design didn't have the southern cross in it (which is the only OCE related thing in the design) i could easily relate it more to Greek then i can OCE (in fact i believe the first thing i thought when i saw the skin was this seems like more of a greek skin then an OCE related one)

Sure i'm one person, but this isn't just a one person thing, honestly, all they have to link it to OCE in general is a small thing, and considering we got comments during the entire process of "we want the skin to be OCE related not just Australian" etc. it's a poor showing when it comes out and is just as easily related to anywhere else in the world.


As for riot in general i will say this, Rioter's aren't bad, this isn't directed at Rioter's in general, just the policys and shit they are forced to follow, fact is Riot OCE treats it's player base like crap, and it's probably not entirely Riot OCE (I still think NA is probably pulling most/all of the strings here) hell i am friends with a few riot members, and played my attempted 1000th win with Rioters, It mostly isn't them, but fact is they are in the position to be blamed as they are looked at as the people who run the server and all the things the come from it.

But i feel there are at least some things they can control and it comes down to the fact that updates need to be driven BY RIOTERS.

As right now i am fairly certain that all the updates we have gotten regarding Naut Statue, CR Kassadin and it's charity, and even teambuilder/Draft are driven by us as a player base being forced to ask them, rather then them actually doing the work to tell us what's happening.

Because there is flat out no excuse for the fact that i had to post this topic, and couldn't be linked to something that Riot had said previously.

The naut reef is a very different case. You can't just drop something into the ocean and be like "good job guys". There would be sooo much red tape to get through, I don't even want to think about it, it would do my head in!

I honestly don't think they screwed us over with the skin. When other regions launched, they got a free region skin, yes. When OCE launched, they didn't have a skin ready, so they gave us pool party ziggs for free (which is an awesome skin). If the alternative was to hold off on the server until they had a skin ready for us, no thanks. I'm just glad we got a server, they worked so hard with ISPs to try and make our shitty Australian internet not screw over the OCE servers, and that we got a free transfer over to our very own server.

I don't play Kassadin, if I did though, I would have 100% bought the skin because I get a cool skin for cheap and know that I'm helping our community raise money for a worthy charity. I do want it to go to a worthy charity though, so I'm glad they are taking the time to find a charity that won't have the managers line their pockets first, as unfortunately many charities do.

Business decisions can take a lot longer than some people realise. It's not as easy as it may seem from an outside perspective.

A) I'm fine with how naut reef is dealt with, hell i made a post in this thread saying so.

>I honestly don't think they screwed us over with the skin. When other regions launched, they got a free region skin, yes. When OCE launched, they didn't have a skin ready, so they gave us pool party ziggs for free (which is an awesome skin). If the alternative was to hold off on the server until they had a skin ready for us, no thanks.

B) Other regions DIDN'T get their region skin at the time, got another skin and still got their region skin, this isn't Apples and Oranges, this is Apples and Apples.

>I'm just glad we got a server, they worked so hard with ISPs to try and make our shitty Australian internet not screw over the OCE servers, and that we got a free transfer over to our very own server.

C) You realize the main reason skins are given out/free transfers happen is so that we are basically beta testing the server yes?
Did you ever even play on the original OCE servers?

>I don't play Kassadin, if I did though, I would have 100% bought the skin because I get a cool skin for cheap and know that I'm helping our community raise money for a worthy charity.

It's really not that good of a skin, and considering it's our region skin, it's pretty damn well pathetic.

Also i'd rather give to a charity of my own chosing then to pay for a shit skin to have my money given to a charity of someone else's choosing (you know after they spend several months deciding where it's going)

>Business decisions can take a lot longer than some people realise. It's not as easy as it may seem from an outside perspective.

This may be the case, but fact is they knew that the server skin was coming, they knew that they would be making us give money to charity, yet it's months after this charity should be getting money and not a cent is given, this is a terrible decision regardless.


EDIT: And i hate people using "oh they gave to charity how good of them" as a reason the skin is good, if they were really being generous it would have been all proceeds from all servers, not just ours, it being from just ours is cheap.

> they knew that they would be making us give money to charity

Or so they say.

I think the fact they hadn't already concluded their research after 2+ years just proves that they didn't have this planned in the first place, they came up with it pretty much "on the spot" so they had an excuse to make us pay for something that should have been free.

I never meant they knew when they were first coming up with a concept of a server skin, i just really doubt that it takes several months to decide on a charity (and if it does, that's called half assing, and just is showing how much they care about charity)

Well, they did state that this was the plan all along. That, since they couldn't come up with a concept some 2 years ago, they made a long term plan to release it at a later date. At a cost... With their excuse being "you already got a free skin and LOOK, CHARITY!"

As a note for all those who really can't understand my negativity to this situation i want to put this whole scenario into a different but similar context.

Imagine you go down to your local fast food restaurant franchise, and they tell you that all meals are 10% off and all profits are going to charity, and that they want their customer base to decide on the type of charity, so they give you a small list of chairty type's that you can pick one from each time you have a meal there, and this goes for a whole week.

On the verge of 3 months after this, someone mentions the charity event, and asks you if you ever found out how much was made/where it went, you say you don't know, and go down to the store, to be told that the money is still being held because they are still deciding on the charity.

Now right now, most of you would be up in arms over this as basically this is not on from any sort of business.

Honestly can anyone tell me why you guys are willing to let Riot off the hook on this?

Sure these scenarios aren't the same, but in real life context it's still basically the same thing.

I respect that you are trying to clarify, so allow me to do the same. 

I'm not letting Riot off the hook, I'm simply asking you have some patience. I have a small amount of experience watching another company I was involved in look for a charity to give a donation to. It is not as simple as choosing a supposedly reputable charity in a given field. The charity system in general is deeply flawed and this causes problems when large donations are involved. A key point to note is that Riot will be looking for a charity where the funds will go directly to what they are theoretically donating to. With many charities that is not the case. Essentially what happens in many charities, is that large portions of the funds donated get lost to what essentially amounts to administrative mumbo jumbo. 

Now I'm not going to pretend to be an expert, but essentially it amounts to the cost of upkeep for the charity. Some charities end up spending upwards of 40% of donated funds on upkeep. You have to play it smart to survive as a non-profit..

So essentially, assuming you were donating to cancer research, to find a charity that you can donate to, in a scenario where at least most of the money you donated goes to actual research is quite difficult. If Riot wants to find a charity that will ensure 90% + of their donation actually goes to whatever cause it may be as opposed to upkeep of the foundation or infrastructure of the charity itself, means they have to find a charity that is self-sufficient enough to provide that.

Here are two examples for you from a site I would recommend for the more casual observer. The thing you want to look at is the percentage next to Program Expenses, because it marks how much of their funds actually go to the program they are supporting.

http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.summary&orgid=13283#.VlLXpnYrJhE
99.3% in program expenses.
i.e 0.7% funds lost to administration etc.

http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.summary&orgid=10512#.VlLYOXYrJhE
56.3% in program expenses.
i.e 43.7% funds lost to administration etc.

Of course this is one source, and these are broad examples from extremes of the spectrum so take that as you should, but this is essentially why it is so hard to find a good charity for large donations. You have to do deeper investigations into each and everyone to determine their overhead and how much is actually going into the program. Larger donations are also treated differently that the average person's $2 donation so there is that to consider/research as well.

http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/cosmic-reaver-kassadin/ Near the end of this it says its going to a charity by a poll choice. 
http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/skin-release/galaxies-crumble-cosmic-reaver-kassadin Here it says they will be donating to somewhere in Medical services / Research 
But yes still no response on how much and if they even given it yet and where exactly did they give the money.
Going to end up like another Nautilus reef again lol
Naut reef makes sense because they can't just dump that shit, but this is no excuse available.

I would be curious to know how much was raised in the end and, when they decide, which charity the money will be going to. But I'm gonna be honest here, you all need to get over it. First of all, it's a pile of pixels, if you don't like it, don't buy it. This dumb discussion dominated the boards for so long, why do you all feel you are so entitled? You got a top quality skin for half price. So what if we didn't get a free skin? We get to play the whole damn game for free. You can play this game with out spending any money so why the bloody hell are you complaining so much about a few dollars that's entirely your choice to spend. If you all hate Riot, the game, and the content so much then why are you still playing?

Seriously, get over the damn skin {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Well i definitely boycotted the skin, it was a bloody disgusting joke. They try to cover up their greed and make people feel guilty for not liking it because the proceeds go to charity. OCE has a pretty huge player base so it's not like they're not getting enough money to pay their employees. All other regions didn't have to pay, I don't know their logic as to why we did.

I'd prefer they come up with 5 skin ideas and share those 5 and have us vote for 1. Surely it's not that hard to come up with a design and implement a free skin into the game. Shit they should just have the community create a skin and they choose 5 and we vote. 

Then after we actually get a server skin then they should create a skin to go towards charity. It's balls having to connect it to the usually free skin when they could of done it with any other skin.
They're going to try sweeping it under the rug and ignoring it, after all  they did screw over the OCE player base.

I mostly want to see how much to see how much of OCE's player base boycotted the skin like they should have.

That and we have a right to know.
